intro: Pilosella polioderma, commonly known as the whitehead mouse-ear, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in grassy areas, meadows, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are hairy and lobed, while the flowers are small, white, and clustered in a flat-topped inflorescence. Pilosella polioderma is often found in open habitats and can tolerate a range of environmental conditions.
